channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. prices far outpace paychecks; centuries-old fruit found at Washington’s home
item.description: Median home prices were about five times the median income last year, according to a Harvard report, and it could get worse. And centuries-old cherries were discovered at George Washington’s home.
item.content:encoded:
Median home prices were about five times the median income last year, according to a Harvard report, and it could get worse. And centuries-old cherries were discovered at George Washington’s home.

(Image credit: Johannes Eisele)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: 6 things Trump says at his rallies and what they really mean
item.description: Former President Donald Trump loves acronyms, but his sayings have become increasingly varied. NPR analyzes six of Trump’s most common catchphrases on the campaign trail in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump loves acronyms, but his sayings have become increasingly varied. NPR analyzes six of Trump’s most common catchphrases on the campaign trail in 2024.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Clayton Kincade

item.title: Russia wages a scorched-earth war in Ukraine with retrofitted bombs and new airstrips
item.description: Russia has accelerated its destruction of Ukraine's front-line cities in 2024 to a scale previously unseen in the war using glide bombs and an expanding network of airstrips just across the border.
item.content:encoded:
Russia has accelerated its destruction of Ukraine's front-line cities in 2024 to a scale previously unseen in the war using glide bombs and an expanding network of airstrips just across the border.

(Image credit: Andrii Marienko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: She's turning her home into a child care site. It may solve a big problem in Alabama
item.description: A project in Alabama seeks to drastically grow the number of home-based child care options. It could help the state's workforce, especially during nontraditional hours.
item.content:encoded:
A project in Alabama seeks to drastically grow the number of home-based child care options. It could help the state's workforce, especially during nontraditional hours.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: A data tool being used to challenge voter registrations is raising many concerns
item.description: There are concerns that a new election data system that's being pushed by conservative activists and is fueling many mass challenges of registrations could kick legitimate voters off the rolls.
item.content:encoded:
There are concerns that a new election data system that's being pushed by conservative activists and is fueling many mass challenges of registrations could kick legitimate voters off the rolls.

(Image credit: Grant Blankenship)
item.dc:creator: Grant Blankenship

item.title: How organizations decide whether to take a stand on social issues
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to marketing expert Professor Marcus Collins about how organizations decide whether to speak out on prominent social issues.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to marketing expert Professor Marcus Collins about how organizations decide whether to speak out on prominent social issues.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Botanists in Vermont rediscovered a plant last seen there at the start of WW1
item.description: A plant was rediscovered by accident in Vermont last month, the first time it was seen in more than a century.
item.content:encoded: A plant was rediscovered by accident in Vermont last month, the first time it was seen in more than a century.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Philadelphia aims to create a pipeline of affordable housing developers with access to capital
item.description: People without easy access to capital are getting into housing development in Philadelphia, as part of a program designed to create more affordable housing and boost non-traditional developers.
item.content:encoded: People without easy access to capital are getting into housing development in Philadelphia, as part of a program designed to create more affordable housing and boost non-traditional developers.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Moselle

item.title: 3 things you need to know about student loans this summer
item.description: The Biden administration's student loan relief program, SAVE, is set to reduce payments this summer for many borrowers, but there are legal challenges looming.
item.content:encoded:
The Biden administration's student loan relief program, SAVE, is set to reduce payments this summer for many borrowers, but there are legal challenges looming.

(Image credit: Janice Chang for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sequoia Carrillo

item.title: It’s called an urgent care emergency center — but which is it?
item.description: Suffering stomach pain, a Dallas man visited his local urgent care clinic — or so he thought, until he got a bill 10 times what he’d expected.
item.content:encoded:
Suffering stomach pain, a Dallas man visited his local urgent care clinic — or so he thought, until he got a bill 10 times what he’d expected.

(Image credit: Laura Buckman)
item.dc:creator: Renuka Rayasam
